story:
Vicky and Kenneth Brown

We founded Sisters of the New South in 2009.  We currently operate three Sisters locations in the Savannah, Georgia area.  We offer "Real Southern Cooking".  Our recipes are family recipes that represent the food we all grew up knowing.  We have been in the restaurant business for over 20 years. 

We have worked diligently to perfect our seasoning for each of our Signature Entree's and Sides.  We mixed and tested for almost a year and finally perfected the seasonings.  We now need the finances to have the seasonings professionally mixed, packaged, and marketed.

Our goal is simple.  We want to offer everyone the opportunity to prepare food with the same tastes and love we all grew up with.

A venture of this magnitude is costly.  Our goal is to raise $50,000.  This will cover the cost of the purchase of the bulk ingredients, the mixing of the seasonings, the cost of the packaging of the seasonings, and the distribution of the seasonings.  There are also costs associated with the labeling, UPC codes, and recipes associated with each product.  Your generosity means the world to us, and with your help, we will be able to meet our goal.  You will be rewarded with samples of the seasonings, Sisters recipe cards, and Sisters meals for supporting our campaign.  There are different levels of perks available.

Your contribution will enable us to distribute our Seasonings for purchase in the retail world.  It will permit us to share our love of Southern Cooking with everyone.

Give what you can, and if you are not able to contribute, please pass this on to everyone.  Help us get the word out to everyone.  Indiegogo has share tools located on our page.

story:
Introduction

Introducing, Earstorms Headphones, the most incredibly lightweight, comfortable and powerful sounding headphones on the market. We have developed a line of headphones that will absolutely blow you away with amazing sound clarity, bass & volume. Finally a headphone that looks good, that's extremely comfortable and has the performance of a true DJ quality headphone. Get ready to be blown away!
 We did not invent the headphone.....we just made it a lot better!!


The Company

As a dealer & distributor of headphones and personal electronics for over 10 years, we took the feedback from our clients and developed our own line of headphones. Our feedback from our clients, are that headphones are too expensive, and the sound quality and volume was not enough when used with their mp3 player, mobile device etc. Well the days of of overpriced & underperforming headphones are over! We are going to revolutionize the industry, by providing the best product out there that is cutting edge and affordable. 

It has taken us a year to get everything right, we tested over 80 different pairs of headphones, blew up more speakers than you could imagine and finally after working with some of the top engineers in the industry, got the look, the sound and the quality that is expected in the audio industry. We used our prototypes to get customers feedback on what you are looking for, and it was clear, a headphone that has volume, that has an amazing sound and that feels good. So if you are looking for a pair of headphones that sound amazing, look incredible and are not bulky, then look no further!

Weighing in at less than 6 ounces, these headphones are the lightest & most powerful sounding on the market, we use only the best materials in the industry including memory foam in the adjustable headband, to make them the most comfortable & durable headphones out there. The headphones are also foldable and very compact, you can fit them in your backpack, purse or gym bag.

There is no need for an external amplifier with our headphones, we have designed our proprietary 40mm magnetic drivers to produce an incredible sound, with amazing highs, mid-range and lows that pack an amazing punch. 

So I know what your thinking, "another headphone company that is going to break the bank", not here, it's why the line was created, because headphones you see for $299.99, just are not worth it, they are a fashion statement. We created these for you, the customer who cares about music, who wants to hear the crisp & clean sound clarity. We created this line of headphones for everyone in mind, from kids to adults, men and women at an affordable cost with an incredible cause & story behind the brand. 

Product Reviews and Comments

Don't just take our word for it, we went to the worlds largest crowdfunding festival for validation on the product and over 3200 people agreed. Our users had the opportunity to an independent head-to-head battle with several brands that included Beats by Dre(Studio), Skullcandy(Crusher & Navigator) Sennheiser(Urbanite) and it was solidified that we had something really great here, we knew the line was that good, because of the hard work and time spent on the line, but we wanted to see what everyone thought, and to say the least, we passed with flying colors. Please read what they had to say, we don't feel our validation is by putting other's down because thats just never good business, here is what everyone had to say about Earstorms Headphones:

  • Callie B. “Absolutely Amazing, the best headphones I have ever heard”
  • Jason T. “I have been a DJ for 12 years and have used every brand out there and I would be these up against my $400.00 ones, keep up the great work, you have something here”.
  • Ryan Q. “Wow, I have never heard anything quite like these, they sound awesome”
  • Stacy R. “How much? Are you serious? These are the best.
  • James K. (who has a pair of Beats Studio around his neck), “you got to be kidding me, I just got these and spent a paycheck on these and these sound a lot better and are only $59.00, sign me up. I am buying these.
  • Marilynn C. “These are just outstanding, I run marathons and cant wear earbuds because they never fit, these are so light and they stay on my head”.
  • Bryan T. “These have to be the best headphones I have ever heard, they are so comfortable.
  • Rick M. “I am absolutely blown away right now, I did not expect this at all, you are truly going places with these, the best”
  • Caleb W. “The highs are absolutely unreal, I like that you can hear the words so clearly, with nice bass that is not annoying”
  • Harold V. “I am just stunned right now, $59.00 for these? I would put these up against anything out there”
  • Stephanie R. “I am so impressed with everything you are doing, the product speaks for itself, but giving back means so much more”, we need more people like you.
  • Scott S. “I am so impressed right now, I don't know what to say” where do I get these.
  • Johnny R: "There really is no comparison here, these are the best by far".
  • Sam T. “I just cant believe my ears right now, the best I have ever heard”
  • Quincy H. “Absolutely unreal, the sound is amazing, I cant believe the volume”
  • Tyler B. “Holy Smokes, these are just amazing, I love the way they feel, the sound is unreal”
  • Paul Q.“Quite possibly the best headphones on the market, I just cant believe they are only $59.00”
  • Phil W. “Everything you want in a headphone, volume, clarity and comfort”


The Cause
We at Earstorms, are very different, as we like to help others, we not only created the best product out there, but we created a company who is giving back in many different ways. We will be donating a portion from each sale back to several charities and organizations, as well as donating a pair for every pair sold. After a near family tragedy, we decided that giving back to charity and organizations was what this company was going to be about. We have found that the power of music is a wonderful thing, when you are going through a tough time, music can be uplifting and bring a smile to your face, no matter what you are going through. We are changing lives by the sounds of music! 

We have decided to give back in any and every way possible with our "Sounds for a Cause" initiative. You are not only getting an amazing product, but you are a backing a company that truly cares and who is making a difference and helping others in need.
We have partnered up with the most amazing local and national charities out there. We have found by meeting with hospitals and organizations, that headphones are a need while you are staying there, so you can just listen to your favorite music or show and take your mind off of whatever is going on. 
Everything from Childrens Hospitals, Breast Cancer Research, Military  Organizations, and many more. We are adding to our list daily and we are always looking for amazing organizations, feel free to contact us if you have suggestions. Our partnerships include:
-Childrens Miracle Network Hospitals
-Make-A-Wish
-Autism Speaks
-K9's for Warriors 
-Special Olympics
-The Donna Foundation
-Dreams Come True 


The Product

ES-1 Detachable Cord Over Ear Headphones

Colors:

-Black

-Bright Green

-Pink

Fully Adjustable Headband

Foldable

4' Detachable Cord w/Inline Mic Control

Plug: 3.5mm

ES-1BT Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones

Colors:

Black Only(for now)

Fully Adjustable Headband

Foldable

Inline Mic Control

USB Charger Included


Buy a Pair & Share Please

We are offering through IndieGoGo the opportunity to purchase a pair of our headphones at amazing price, the retail price is $139.99 for the Over-Ear-Headphones, but as an early bird option, we are offering them at more than half off at: 
$59.00 for the Over-Ear Headphones & $89.00 for the Wireless Model.
**Includes shipping anywhere in the United States. There is an option to ship internationally. 
***Please note, we are not a concept, we are ready to go to production, unlike the others, you will not be waiting a year + to get your goods, we are projecting after our successful campaign, we should be around 30-60 days, hopefully sooner! I know a lot of you have backed projects and you got nothing, be rest assured that is not us. We are using our funding goal for inventory purposes, the hard part of development costs are done. 
We are a tried, tested and true product and company, you are truly going to be blown away with the look, quality and sound. Please share this with anybody and everybody you know, be a part of something amazing, a company and a product with a purpose. 

Website: www.earstorms.com

Please follow us on Facebook @: www.facebook.com/earstorms 

Please follow us on Twitter @: www.twitter.com/earstormsaudio 

Find us on Instagram @: www.instagram.com/earstorms

Feel free if you have any questions to contact our staff @: earstorms.com@gmail.com


Thank you so much for your support, we look forward to rocking your ears very soon!

story:
Until now, no private organization has offered an impervious, impenetrable and permanent DNA storage vault, able to provide virtually every man, woman and child on Earth, a safe and secure, nuclear blast-proof, underground shelter to store their DNA, for their own future regenerative medical needs, or even for the preservation and potential restoration of the human race itself!

Best of all, the storage is free and totally private!  

Only you can identify your DNA sample once it is in the vault, using your QR Code.  Vivos does not know which Donor Card belongs to any Donor.

Our double-blind QR security system assures donor privacy, while protecting personal identification of each DNA sample. Effectively, donors are thereby anonymous to all parties, while providing and preserving their DNA for their own potential future medical needs, or to remain as a part of the human genome pool.

See more Security Details below.



It is predicted in the near future, your own DNA will be used to extend your life.  Healthy DNA will be used as a means of regenerative medicine, to restore normal healthy function to body organs, skin tissue, and parts damaged by disease, injured by trauma, or just worn out by time.  Storing a small sample of your DNA as it exists today may assure you longer life through cures and the restoration of virtually every cell in your body.


As you age, your body's cells die and are continuously duplicated in the process of DNA replication. However, with each subsequent cell division a portion of the tips of the DNA strand, called the Telomeres, are inherently damaged. The deterioration and shortening of the Telomeres is what causes your body to degenerate and age.

Therefore, your best DNA is available at birth. Regardless of your age, tomorrow your DNA will not be as healthy as it is today. This is why it is important to capture and store your DNA in its present condition, before it further deteriorates.

        


What if you forgot to store your DNA and need it later in life when science is ready and able to cure virtually any disease with your own undamaged DNA, but you failed to store it?   Worse yet, what if an environmental catastrophe destroys your DNA, requiring your former, healthy DNA for restoration, but there is none?


    

   


Vivos was originally envisioned and built to accommodate thousands of people in the event of a major global extinction level event which could destroy the world as we know it.  However, Vivos has come to realize that it has a higher purpose; to create the Vivos Global Genome Vault, where virtually every person on the planet can store his or her DNA for its long-term preservation and protection.


Using the latest technology of DNA collection storage, “blood card” technology collects, separates and fractionates whole blood into DNA-containing cellular, serum and small molecule components in 5 minutes.  Utilizing a unique linear separation chromotography, once the donor deposits just 5 droplets of whole blood on the Donor Card, the special strip separates and dries the whole blood components in minutes. The cards can then be stored at room temperature for an indefinite period without degradation.

Double-blind security and privacy is assured to protect the identity of all donors from any invasive government inspection. Each DNA blood card has a random two-dimensional QR code labeling system. Once received by Vivos, there is no way of tracing who the donor was, until the donor provides a copy of a second Donor Reference Card that the donor retains with the matching QR code symbol. Only a donor can provide the information that will identify their actual DNA sample within the Vivos vaults. 

This system assures donor privacy, while protecting personal identification of each DNA sample. Effectively, donors are thereby anonymous to outside sources, while providing and preserving their DNA for their own potential future medical needs, or to remain as a part of the human genome pool.

To further insure the preservation and survival of all DNA samples, Vivos is also offering donors the opportunity to collocate their DNA in both the United States and Europe.  Both deep underground shelters offer virtually impervious protection in their hermetically sealed vaults. 

Whether stored for years, decades or more than a century, the Vivos Global Genome Vault pool will be a perpetual depository, preserving life on Earth as we know it.

The Vivos Global Genome Vault will include a group of explanatory illustrations etched on metal plates.  Drawings will include the entire double helix, atom by atom to represent the individual elements.  To emphasize the point, added pictures of humans and other living beings will be included in the etchings explaining the essence of all life. 


In addition, a comprehensive library of books and digital reference materials on the science of DNA will be sealed within the vaults for future re-education. This information will provide a viable knowhow for any future regeneration as an "Ark of Humanity”!

Vivos has developed the world’s largest network of deep underground, blast-proof survival shelters, with a goal to accommodate thousands of people in the face of an epic global catastrophe.  However, along the way, we realized that there are only a very limited number of people who can afford to purchase a space in one of our shelters.  So, we chose to make Vivos available to virtually every man, woman and child on Earth, by storing their DNA in massive hermetically sealed vaults located within the Vivos shelters.  

We then learned how this would not only be an Ark for Humanity, creating the largest gene pool ever, but a means of storage and preservation of DNA for use in regenerative medicine while you are still living! Now the BIGGER purpose of Vivos was becoming crystal clear.  Vivos will always be an “Ark”, but now it can also be the proverbial “Fountain of Youth”!  

In the very near future, medical science will be able to use your own, undamaged DNA to restore your organs, including: heart, kidney, skin, bone, tissue, lungs, liver, blood vessels, and cure everything from cancer to blindness. However, your DNA is dying and aging with each cellular regeneration. The Telomeres are shortening, thereby losing some of the valuable embedded code that you were born with.  This is what causes aging and a deterioration of your health.

Donors purchase a low-cost DNA collection kit that provides both an Official Donor Card with a patented enzyme strip where you will place 5 droplets of your blood; and, a Donor Reference Card that you will keep in a safe place.  You will then place a small QR code sticker on both the Donor Card and your Reference Card.  This QR code is the only means of identifying, matching and sourcing your DNA in the Vivos vaults.  Vivos retains no cross referencing for any donor card, so it is impossible for either Vivos or any government agency to identify your Donor Card from the millions of other samples.  If and when you need to have your own DNA sample returned, you simply send us a photo of your Reference Card and the QR sticker.   We will then be able to match the QR codes and locate your specific DNA sample in the vault for retrieval. 

We are seeking just $100,000 in Phase 1 of our launch. To reach that goal we have packaged a variety of very affordable and unique perks so you can get your DNA into a Vivos vault, or even two vaults by collocating two samples of your DNA on two continents.  


What if you need your younger, undamaged DNA in the future and you failed to preserve it today? The consequences may be the difference of living a longer healthier life, or not!

Due to the scale of this epic project and that fact that the Vivos shelters already exist, the cost of storage is amazingly affordable!  For as little as $20.00 (a one-time fee) you can store your DNA and obtain the life-assurance protection that will be PRICELESS, if you ever need it in the future. There’s no better or more important opportunity in the world, then to have made the wise choice to preserve your life, before it is too late!


See All Options Above To Order

Shipments outside of the United States will incur an additional charge.

© Copyright 2015, The Vivos Group, Del Mar, CA 92014 USA

human race itself!

story:
Plant medicine has worked for many people for whom Western medicine has not addressed their illnesses. Michele had her chronic insomnia cured here; Roberto was cured of pre-cancerous lung nodules and many other testimonials are available here: http://www.peruayahuasca.com/#!__page-6

Four of us have gathered here to crowdsource funds for our dear Peruvian friends and teachers, Carlos and Juan Chavez. These two brothers are Peruvian Shamans, carrying on the healing work of previous generations of healers and shamans in their family. They have been healing people of physical, emotional and mental illnesses from countries around the world for over 20 years, in Tarapoto in Peru. They don't have a place of their own and are at the mercy of a few landlords who charge them too much rent.

In addition to this, sourcing the medicine plants that they use to heal people with is becoming more difficult as deforestation continues to take its toll. It is their dream to have their own healing center and botanical gardens to grow their own medicine plants and perform ceremonies. With that in mind, we four have so far raised $10,000 to help them buy the most perfect piece of land near Tarapoto in Peru. Carlos and Juan have identified 25 beautiful, unspoiled acres of land on the shoreline of Laguna Azul, with a river running through it and fresh drinking water piped to it. We have 30 days to raise the remaining $10,500 for the property and need your help.

Carlos and Juan operate with a high degree of integrity and love. The extent to which they undertake the healing process with their guests (not 'for' them, but 'with' them - there is a distinction in this, which is unfamiliar to most people) is unparallelled in our experience, which is why we are helping them to raise these funds.

We feel strongly that finding a true Healer these days is rare and we want to ensure that Carlos and Juan have the opportunity to practice in a safe, secure and healthy environment.

story:
"What is the use of living, if it not be to strive for noble causes and to make this muddled world a better place for those who will live in it after we are gone?”
— Winston Churchill (speech in Dundee, 1908)

Cluster Headache is one of the most painful and debilitating conditions known to medical science, yet most people have never even heard of it. It is rare, occurring in about .1% of the population, and as such has very little support for research and development of new medications. In fact, there are no available preventive medications for this disease that strikes down the sufferer multiple times a day. Please help us raise awareness by wearing this t-shirt, donating toward research and awareness efforts, or at least sharing our link. We'll take all the help we can get!

The Cluster Headache Support Group, Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to improving the lives of Cluster Headache sufferers through Research, Education, Fact-based Information, and Compassionate Support. All donations are tax deductable and 100% of funds go toward our objectives.

Find us!
Our website: http://chsg.org

Our 2015 Objectives:

  • Continued research on ketamine infusion therapy with Jefferson Headache Center and potentially 2 more centers, publish outcomes ongoing
  • New research initiatives regarding TRP Channels as new target areas; specifically leveraging biopharm and phase IIB clinical study TRP V1, A1, and M8 antagonists the specifically address hypersensitivity to known triggers for both migraine and cluster headache and related trigeminal autonomic cephalgias. These triggers include the perception of moderate temperature and atmospheric pressure changes, noxious chemicals, vallinoid-based scents, and bright light sensitivity. There are several candidates already in the pipeline showing positive results, however, not yet indicated for headache.
  • Deliver a Spiral Research Portal focused on ongoing data collection and reporting while also providing helpful data logging and doctor's office patient visit summary reports that will ease consistency in data capture, reporting, and turning anecdotal evidence into an aggregate information database for research and reporting.
  • Continued Awareness and Advocacy efforts with special focus in partnering with Healthcare and the Biopharma/Pharmaceutical industry as well as major headache research and healthcare centers.
  • Continued improvements in our web site and social networking presence, especially across multiple devices such as smart phones, tablets, and common computing platforms.
  • Patient and Healthcare educational and training materials
  • Triple our patient reach in 2015, further reducing the number who currently suffer alone and without current and complete information regarding options, both approved and not yet approved physical and mental health treatments, financial and career support programs, and compassionate support for those in need.

Our 2014 Objectives include:

  • Continued research on ketamine infusion therapy with Jefferson Headache Center and potentially 2 more centers, publish outcomes ongoing
  • Establish a Patient Registry of cluster headache sufferers. This will greatly assist future research.
  • Establish Rare Disorder status for cluster headache in the NORD registry (https://www.rarediseases.org/rare-disease-information/rare-diseases/byID/720/viewAbstract)
  • Engage directly with the pharmaceutical industry to educate and identify opportunities
  • Continued awareness efforts with a focus on expanded public, healthcare, and patient information and tools
  • Continued rapid growth in reaching cluster headache sufferers to provide direct support, accurate and trustworthy information, and opportunities to contribute to others
  • Continue to provide patient medical supplies, specifically O2PTIMASKS and related materials at a reduced cost to patients
  • Extend reach to include educational magazine rack inserts for doctors offices
  • Revamp CHSG.org to provide dynamic mobile device support and relevant apps, updated content and research materials, and a new look and feel

This is of course not all we do, but it's the gist of our focus.

story:
***update 2/3/15 - 7:00PM***

***update 2/3/15 - 8:00AM***
We've reached the 38% mark! Big thanks to everyone who donated, tweeted, retweeted and shared our links on Facebook and Wordpress. There's still a long way to go to be completely funded, but I see light at the end of the tunnel. :)
Also, the TV pitch offer is extended to EVERYONE!  $25 gets you two submissions to my fav network, NBC and its affiliates (Bravo, Esquire, E!, NBC, Oxygen, USA, Syfy) !
***update 1-21-2015***
GET YOUR TV IDEA IN FRONT OF A NETWORK TV EXECUTIVE
For every #scriptchat or #tvwriterchat member who helps me achieve my goal with a donation of $25 I will accept and submit two TV concepts on their behalf to the appropriate NBC network. I cannot guarantee a pitch meeting but your work will be seen and considered by real television executives. If you don't have access to TV networks this could be your one shot. Take it!

=======================================================

I am moving forward with a new zest on life, new appreciation for family and friends, and endless passion for doing what I love to do: write!

WHO AM I

My name is ANGELO BELL and I am a writer, director and independent producer, and most importantly... a father of four amazing children. Life nearly took me away from my daughters, Israel, Cimone and Imara, and my son, Zachary. Thankfully, I was given a second chance.

WHAT HAPPENED

There comes a time in everyone's life when they think about how things would be different if they were given a second chance. In December, 2014 I got my second chance.

Early in November I began to have these weird shortness of breath episodes. They kind of came out of nowhere. On my job I routinely walk 3+ miles each night, including stairs, so there was no reason why I should've become short of breath. I'd gotten really good at exercising while working and I'd even lost about ten pounds. Being a typical man, I pushed through my breathing problems even as my lungs burned and chest heaved. But in 48 hours everything changed.

Saturday, November 29, 2014 I went to dinner with my friend Isidro. We went for a walk afterwards. My chest started to burn for no reason and I found myself panting even though our walk was short. The next day I went to work at in Westminster. It rained that all day and I had to take the bus home (car problems) so I wasn't thrilled. But things were different. Usually I was able to walk, climb stairs, even jog and little. Even though I'd have to take a moment to catch my breath, I could always move. But as the day went on and night approached, my difficulty breathing increased.

By the time I left work at 8pm and headed to the bus stop most of the streets were flooded and the idea of walking more than a block pissed me off. I made it home around 10pm and had to walk five blocks in the rain to get home. Now, just one week earlier I took that walk like it was nothing. But this time was different. I remember feeling like I was going to faint from lack of oxygen. I had to stop twice on my way to my apartment to catch my breath. I've never had to do that before. Ever.

At home I planted myself in my armchair in front of the TV. As long as I didn't move I was fine. Unfortunately, as soon as I stood, walked to the bathroom or kitchen I would literally have to stop and catch my breath. It was crazy!

Bedtime came and I was exhausted. I used a large beanbag cushion to prop myself up in my bed because lying flat made it difficult to breath. I remember my heart was racing like I'd run a marathon. Eventually I fell asleep.

LIFE AND DEATH

Sometime after 2am I heard my roommate. I sat up in bed and then it hit me -- I was breathing fast but it felt as if oxygen was missing from that equation. I walked to the bathroom only ten feet away and when I returned my breathing worsen. I tried deep breaths but that didn't help. Nothing helped. I wondered if I'd make it through the night. I couldn't breathe! I started to panic.

At that moment I thought about calling someone -- anyone. I considered calling 911. Nope, I didn't want to get embarrassed if this was a false alarm. Even worse, I wasn't sure if I could gather my breath long enough to speak to the 911 Operator. I thought about calling my roommate but I'd have to yell and that might make me pass out from oxygen deprivation. How long could I last? An hour? Minutes. Was I about to take my last breath at any moment?

But I told myself to calm down and miraculously, I did. I couldn't take deep breaths so I took shallow and rapid breaths. My heart rate slowed just enough for me to change out of my pajamas and into jeans without losing it. I figured if I was going to the ER I was NOT going while wearing my Santa Claus pajamas.

I called 911.

The 911 Operator told me to open my front door and sat down and wait. I waited in my armchair, not moving a muscle. I heard the fire truck enter the parking lot accompanied by an ambulance. Seconds later eight people poured into my living room: four firemen, four trainees, and two people from CARE Ambulance.

They took my blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen level (oxygen saturation). They took my blood pressure three times, twice with the machine and once manually because it was super high: 206/107. My heart rate was in the 140s. I seem to remember my Oxygen saturation numbers being at 72 when they should be 96-100. They hooked me to an oxygen tank, and I could breath again. I was hoping the paramedics would simply stabilize me and let me go back to sleep. The fireman in charge said, "No, you're going to the ER."

I arrived at Tri-city Regional Health Center and went straight into ER. I was given oxygen, two IVs and an X-Ray. Something about some cardiac fluid being present meant my heart had been working overtime, and that was not a good thing. At one point they thought I'd had a heart attack. Diagnosis: pneumonia and I was very hypertensive. They checked me in and brought me to my room. I think they considered giving me a CAT scan but because my insurance situation at the time was iffy they skipped it and opted for an ultrasound of the arteries in my legs. I stayed in the hospital for three days, was released with antibiotics for the pneumonia and meds for the high blood pressure.

I came home on a Wednesday. By Thursday I was starting to feel that same shortness of breath again. I texted my sister in law, a Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), for advice. I told her I wasn't getting better.

Friday I stayed glued to my chair. My kids came over and I only got up to make dinner and help with homework. But by 6pm I'd had two scary "episodes" of wheezing just by walking to the bathroom. My oblique muscles and abs had minds of their own. They would squeeze and tighten in spasms in an effort to squeeze more oxygen into my body. My sister-in-law took me to the ER again where I had another oxygen treatment and they sent me on my way.

Unfortunately by Sunday night I was even worse. Any movement whatsoever resulted in a 2-3 minute gasping attack and now my throat was closing! During one episode I was so sure I was going to die I took the automatic lock off my cell phone. I figured that when my LA family found my body they would need to get in contact with my family back in NY and all the information was in my phone.

Luckily, I made it through the night but come Monday morning, December 8, I was terrified. I sat on my bed afraid to even go to the bathroom. I'd walk to the toilet and as I would pee I'd be gasping and wheezing. I called my sister-in-law again. I told her something is really, really wrong. "Help," I begged. It's a good thing I continue to get along with my ex-wife’s family :)

My sister-in-law arranged for her husband to take me to a different hospital, the one where she works in Long Beach. She met me in the ambulance ER area with a wheelchair and took me inside.

While I was trying to stand up in the wheelchair and sit on the gurney in ER I had a terrible wheezing attack and the triage nurses saw it. My heart rate was in the 150s. Blood oxygen saturation was in the mid 80s and I was severely dehydrated. I got two IVs and fluid immediately. The doctor came in and said something to this effect. "The pneumonia and high blood pressure I get, but we need to figure out why you can't breathe, and we will."

From what I understand the blood tests showed decreased kidney function too, which made the CAT scan technician reluctant to allow me into radiology/imaging. It was a risk to give me that dye they shoot into your veins. But my ER doc approved it and off I went.

HOW DID "THAT" GET THERE?

About 20 minutes after the CAT scan my sister-in-law and the RN treating me came into my little area. The RN whispered something in my sister's ear. Now, let me just say, my sister-in-law is usually stoic. She handles adversity like the best of 'em. But after the RN whispered in her ear... she started to CRY. Seeing her cry made me cry (on the inside). She said, "Now we know what's wrong and we know what to do."

The doctor returned, smiling. There was no more mystery behind my rapidly deteriorating ability to breath. He told me they found a massive saddle Pulmonary Embolism. It was choking off blood to my lungs -- both sides. I had no lower lung function at all, which was why deep breaths did nothing for me. I was sucking air into a part of my lungs that could do nothing with it. Everyone looked at me with astonishment. The clot was HUGE, I was told. I probably would have died in a few days. I certainly would not have made it to Christmas.

I was put on a Heparin drip and a "clot buster." I was a good candidate for the intravenous clot buster because I was younger and stronger than most patients who get it

I spent the next three days in ICU and then seven days in the Heart Center. I had an ultrasound on my legs which turned showed DVT (deep vein thrombosis) behind my left knee. This clot was probably the bastard that broke off and lodged in my lungs. Turns out the whole blood clot in the lungs thing had some affect on my heart, which was slightly enlarged from working overtime due to the PE. Over the next ten days I had daily blood tests, IVs stuck in either arm, and oxygen connected to my nose. I saw a cardiologist, a doctor of internal medicine, a hematologist and a pulmonologist. It was surreal to have these doctors visit me and hear each of them make the same comment, "Mr. Bell, it's amazing that you are here."

I was released from the hospital on December 20th. My sister-in-law took me home. I was able to walk the flight to my 2nd floor home without incident. My 13-year-old, Cimone, came to take care of me. I made it home for Christmas! And thanks to the generosity of Santa's amazing elves, I was able to give my children an awesome Christmas.

MOVING AHEAD

I feel resurrected. A friend of mine said there's nothing like a near-death experience to get your mind right and help you focus on the important things in life. But it's hard to do that under the crushing weight of bills.

Now the New Year is here and I'm going after a fresh start. I need to be healthy physically and financially. Family friends and career -- that's what it's all about.

I didn't work for the entire month of December and first two weeks of January. I'm still not sure when I will be cleared to go back to work. Filing for Disability Insurance in California leaves you at the mercy of doctors and state bureaucracy.

I've humbly decided to ask for help. Thankfully my six-figure hospital bill is mostly covered as are most of my meds and weekly doctor visits for the next two months. But the month off left a huge deficit in my budget.

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED?

Simply. All the money raised will go to help me catch up on rent and expenses, pay uncovered medical bills, buy meds and buy some cheap clothes (I lost so much weight 90% of my closet stuff is too big for me).

I have been given a second chance. I don't look at life the same way now. In order to take advantage of the opportunities before me I need to get settled financially and physically once again. Once I do that I'll be able to enjoy my children, my friends AND excel at my chosen profession -- PRODUCING GREAT CONTENT FOR FILM AND TELEVISION. This year I'm shooting a pilot dammit! My project BROKEN HEARTS CLUB has made the rounds on TV in the US, Canada, Italy, Belgium and the UAE. Now it's streaming on Amazon Instant Video. My indie thriller, RESURRECTION OF SERIOUS ROGERS has been downloaded over 40,000 times from all over the world. Last year a script analyst compared my screenplay, A PERFECT WEAPON to the Coen Brother's film, NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN. In the past 24 months I've met with executives at NBCUniversal 24 times to pitch TV show ideas to NBC, USA, BRAVO, OXYGEN, E!, and ESQUIRE.

I just want to look back at 2014 and shake my head and whisper, "You didn't beat me!"

I HAVE SOMETHING FOR YOU :)

When you donate $25 or more you will receive a Twitter THANK YOU, a Facebook ATTABOY... PLUS: you'll get digital downloads of my best movies and screenplays, PLUS you'll be added to my private mailing list where you receive a FREE copy of any and every movie, screenplay or TV show I personally create PERIOD! FROM NOW ON.
story_txt:
***update 2/3/15 - 7:00PM***


***update 2/3/15 - 8:00AM***We've reached the 38% mark! Big thanks to everyone who donated, tweeted, retweeted and shared our links on Facebook and Wordpress. There's still a long way to go to be completely funded, but I see light at the end of the tunnel. :)Also, the TV pitch offer is extended to EVERYONE!  $25 gets you two submissions to my fav network, NBC and its affiliates (Bravo, Esquire, E!, NBC, Oxygen, USA, Syfy) !
***update 1-21-2015***GET YOUR TV IDEA IN FRONT OF A NETWORK TV EXECUTIVEFor every #scriptchat or #tvwriterchat member who helps me achieve my goal with a donation of $25 I will accept and submit two TV concepts on their behalf to the appropriate NBC network. I cannot guarantee a pitch meeting but your work will be seen and considered by real television executives. If you don't have access to TV networks this could be your one shot. Take it!
=======================================================I am moving forward with a new zest on life, new appreciation for family and friends, and endless passion for doing what I love to do: write!
WHO AM IMy name is ANGELO BELL and I am a writer, director and independent producer, and most importantly... a father of four amazing children. Life nearly took me away from my daughters, Israel, Cimone and Imara, and my son, Zachary. Thankfully, I was given a second chance.  WHAT HAPPENEDThere comes a time in everyone's life when they think about how things would be different if they were given a second chance. In December, 2014 I got my second chance. Early in November I began to have these weird shortness of breath episodes. They kind of came out of nowhere. On my job I routinely walk 3+ miles each night, including stairs, so there was no reason why I should've become short of breath.  I'd gotten really good at exercising while working and I'd even lost about ten pounds.  Being a typical man, I pushed through my breathing problems even as my lungs burned and chest heaved. But in 48 hours everything changed.Saturday, November 29, 2014 I went to dinner with my friend Isidro. We went for a walk afterwards. My chest started to burn for no reason and I found myself panting even though our walk was short.  The next day I went to work at in Westminster. It rained that all day and I had to take the bus home (car problems) so I wasn't thrilled. But things were different. Usually I was able to walk, climb stairs, even jog and little. Even though I'd have to take a moment to catch my breath, I could always move. But as the day went on and night approached, my difficulty breathing increased.By the time I left work at 8pm and headed to the bus stop most of the streets were flooded and the idea of walking more than a block pissed me off. I made it home around 10pm and had to walk five blocks in the rain to get home. Now, just one week earlier I took that walk like it was nothing. But this time was different. I remember feeling like I was going to faint from lack of oxygen. I had to stop twice on my way to my apartment to catch my breath. I've never had to do that before. Ever.At home I planted myself in my armchair in front of the TV. As long as I didn't move I was fine. Unfortunately, as soon as I stood, walked to the bathroom or kitchen I would literally have to stop and catch my breath. It was crazy! Bedtime came and I was exhausted. I used a large beanbag cushion to prop myself up in my bed because lying flat made it difficult to breath. I remember my heart was racing like I'd run a marathon.  Eventually I fell asleep.LIFE AND DEATHSometime after 2am I heard my roommate. I sat up in bed and then it hit me -- I was breathing fast but it felt as if oxygen was missing from that equation. I walked to the bathroom only ten feet away and when I returned my breathing worsen.  I tried deep breaths but that didn't help. Nothing helped. I wondered if I'd make it through the night. I couldn't breathe! I started to panic.At that moment I thought about calling someone -- anyone. I considered calling 911. Nope, I didn't want to get embarrassed if this was a false alarm. Even worse, I wasn't sure if I could gather my breath long enough to speak to the 911 Operator. I thought about calling my roommate but I'd have to yell and that might make me pass out from oxygen deprivation. How long could I last? An hour? Minutes. Was I about to take my last breath at any moment?But I told myself to calm down and miraculously, I did. I couldn't take deep breaths so I took shallow and rapid breaths. My heart rate slowed just enough for me to change out of my pajamas and into jeans without losing it. I figured if I was going to the ER I was NOT going while wearing my Santa Claus pajamas. I called 911.The 911 Operator told me to open my front door and sat down and wait. I waited in my armchair, not moving a muscle.  I heard the fire truck enter the parking lot accompanied by an ambulance. Seconds later eight people poured into my  living room: four firemen, four trainees, and two people from CARE Ambulance.They took my blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen level (oxygen saturation). They took my blood pressure three times, twice with the machine and once manually because it was super high: 206/107. My heart rate was in the 140s. I seem to remember my Oxygen saturation numbers being at 72 when they should be 96-100. They hooked me to an oxygen tank, and I could breath again. I was hoping the paramedics would simply stabilize me and let me go back to sleep. The fireman in charge said, "No, you're going to the ER."I arrived at Tri-city Regional Health Center and went straight into ER. I was given oxygen, two IVs and an X-Ray. Something about some cardiac fluid being present meant my heart had been working overtime, and that was not a good thing. At one point they thought I'd had a heart attack. Diagnosis:  pneumonia and I was very hypertensive. They checked me in and brought me to my room. I think they considered giving me a CAT scan but because my insurance situation at the time was iffy they skipped it and opted for an ultrasound of the arteries in my legs. I stayed in the hospital for three days, was released with antibiotics for the pneumonia and meds for the high blood pressure. I came home on a Wednesday. By Thursday I was starting to feel that same shortness of breath again. I texted my sister in law, a Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), for advice. I told her I wasn't getting better.Friday I stayed glued to my chair. My kids came over and I only got up to make dinner and help with homework. But by 6pm I'd had two scary "episodes" of wheezing just by walking to the bathroom. My oblique muscles and abs had minds of their own. They would squeeze and tighten in spasms in an effort to squeeze more oxygen into my body.  My sister-in-law took me to the ER again where I had another oxygen treatment and they sent me on my way. Unfortunately by Sunday night I was even worse. Any movement whatsoever resulted in a 2-3 minute gasping attack and now my throat was closing! During one episode I was so sure I was going to die I took the automatic lock off my cell phone. I figured that when my LA family found my body they would need to get in contact with my family back in NY and all the information was in my phone. Luckily, I made it through the night but come Monday morning, December 8, I was terrified. I sat on my bed afraid to even go to the bathroom. I'd walk to the toilet and as I would pee I'd be gasping and wheezing. I called my sister-in-law again. I told her something is really, really wrong. "Help," I begged. It's a good thing I continue to get along with my ex-wife’s family :)My sister-in-law arranged for her husband to take me to a different hospital, the one where she works in Long Beach. She met me in the ambulance ER area with a wheelchair and took me inside. While I was trying to stand up in the wheelchair and sit on the gurney in ER I had a terrible wheezing attack and the triage nurses saw it. My heart rate was in the 150s. Blood oxygen saturation was in the mid 80s and I was severely dehydrated. I got two IVs and fluid immediately. The doctor came in and said something to this effect. "The pneumonia and high blood pressure I get, but we need to figure out why you can't breathe, and we will." From what I understand the blood tests showed decreased kidney function too, which made the CAT scan technician reluctant to allow me into radiology/imaging.  It was a risk to give me that dye they shoot into your veins. But my ER doc approved it and off I went.HOW DID "THAT" GET THERE?About 20 minutes after the CAT scan my sister-in-law and the RN treating me came into my little area. The RN whispered something in my sister's ear. Now, let me just say, my sister-in-law is usually stoic. She handles adversity like the best of 'em. But after the RN whispered in her ear... she started to CRY. Seeing her cry made me cry (on the inside). She said, "Now we know what's wrong and we know what to do."The doctor returned, smiling. There was no more mystery behind my rapidly deteriorating ability to breath. He told me they found a massive saddle Pulmonary Embolism. It was choking off blood to my lungs -- both sides. I had no lower lung function at all, which was why deep breaths did nothing for me. I was sucking air into a part of my lungs that could do nothing with it. Everyone looked at me with astonishment. The clot was HUGE, I was told. I probably would have died in a few days. I certainly would not have made it to Christmas. I was put on a Heparin drip and a "clot buster."  I was a good candidate for the intravenous clot buster because I was younger  and stronger than most patients who get itI spent the next three days in ICU and then seven days in the Heart Center. I had an ultrasound on my legs which turned showed DVT (deep vein thrombosis) behind my left knee. This clot was probably the bastard that broke off and lodged in my lungs.   Turns out the whole blood clot in the lungs thing had some affect on my heart, which was slightly enlarged from working overtime due to the PE.  Over the next ten days I had daily blood tests, IVs stuck in either arm, and oxygen connected to my nose.  I saw a cardiologist, a doctor of internal medicine, a hematologist and a pulmonologist. It was surreal to have these doctors visit me and hear each of them make the same comment, "Mr. Bell, it's amazing that you are here."I was released from the hospital on December 20th. My sister-in-law took me home. I was able to walk the flight to my 2nd floor home without incident. My 13-year-old, Cimone, came to take care of me. I made it home for Christmas! And thanks to the generosity of Santa's amazing elves, I was able to give my children an awesome Christmas.MOVING AHEADI feel resurrected. A friend of mine said there's nothing like a near-death experience to get your mind right and help you focus on the important things in life. But it's hard to do that under the crushing weight of bills.Now the New Year is here and I'm going after a fresh start. I need to be healthy physically and financially. Family friends and career -- that's what it's all about. I didn't work for the entire month of December and first two weeks of January. I'm still not sure when I will be cleared to go back to work. Filing for Disability Insurance in California leaves you at the mercy of doctors and state bureaucracy. I've humbly decided to ask for help. Thankfully my six-figure hospital bill is mostly covered as are most of my meds and weekly doctor visits for the next two months. But the month off left a huge deficit in my budget.HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED?Simply. All the money raised will go to help me catch up on rent and expenses, pay uncovered medical bills, buy meds and buy some cheap clothes (I lost so much weight 90% of my closet stuff is too big for me).I have been given a second chance. I don't look at life the same way now. In order to take advantage of the opportunities before me I need to  get settled financially and physically once again. Once I do that I'll be able to enjoy my children, my friends AND excel at my chosen profession -- PRODUCING GREAT CONTENT FOR FILM AND TELEVISION. This year I'm shooting a pilot dammit!   My project BROKEN HEARTS CLUB has made the rounds on TV in the US, Canada, Italy, Belgium and the UAE. Now it's streaming on Amazon Instant Video. My indie thriller, RESURRECTION OF SERIOUS ROGERS has been downloaded over 40,000 times from all over the world.  Last year a script analyst compared my screenplay, A PERFECT WEAPON to the Coen Brother's film, NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN.  In the past 24 months I've met with executives at NBCUniversal 24 times to pitch TV show ideas to NBC, USA, BRAVO, OXYGEN, E!, and ESQUIRE. I just want to look back at 2014 and shake my head and whisper, "You didn't beat me!" I HAVE SOMETHING FOR YOU :)When you donate $25 or more you will receive a Twitter THANK YOU, a Facebook ATTABOY... PLUS: you'll get digital downloads of my best movies and screenplays, PLUS you'll be added to my private mailing list where you receive a FREE copy of any and every movie, screenplay or TV show I personally create PERIOD! story:
We are rescuing thousands of impoverished lives by bringing hope to people with no available medical care through Doron Medical Center.

We have already gathered hundreds of thousands of dollars.  The land is purchased, the foundation has been laid and the walls and roof are completed.

We are entering the final push in equipping and staffing the medical facility.  With your donations, Doron Medical Center will become self-sustaining and able to meet the needs of the poor in the rural communities.

The financial self-sustaining model we have implemented will give your donation an effective  leverage in continuing to help men, women and children for years to come. You can further  leverage your dollar by telling and sharing with your family, friends, co.-workers, clientele and business associates of this unique opportunity to help save human lives. 

Time is of the essence and we need your participation now

We are a 501(c)3 charitable non-profit and have successfully raised money for over 30 fresh water wells, countless local medical outreaches, and sponsored numerous leadership seminars. For more information please log onto our website at www.MeaningfulLifeInternational.org to learn more.

story: For as long as I can remember I've had a job and paid my own bills. I'm very independent and at times I can be stubborn. For those reasons asking for donations and help is very hard for me. Most people don't know but I recently had a Cerclage done in December Due to my weak cervix and almost losing my baby again. A Cerclage is a surgery when your cervix is stitched closed to prevent pre-term labor. Due to this surgery I have been on bedrest until the baby is born (DRs orders) I can't stand for long periods of time and I definitely can't do what I've always done to make ends meet.. Work! The bills are becoming increasingly overwhelming with no income and very minor help from close ones. I've finally had to learn its ok to ask for help especially during this very unexpected situation. Every single dollar would help me out and I would be beyond thankful!! Thank you <3 :)

story:
Currently, there are nearly 44 million people worldwide that are believed to be living with Alzheimer's disease or other dementias. By 2030, we will see an increase to nearly 76 million. By 2050, rates could exceed 135 million.

                              

Dementia causes damage to the brain that can interrupt brain pathways that allow adults to perform important everyday tasks such as making a meal or managing one’s finances. Disruptions of these pathways can significantly impact one’s ability to live independently. The program we are helping to develop has been highly successful in an in-person setting and numerous scientific papers have shown its effectiveness. Our goal is to make this program accessible through the Internet.  


Goal Management Training® is a course designed to improve brain function
in those people with memory and attention issues so that they can get things done in their lives much better and quicker than they have in years. Things like recognizing faces and names, completing daily tasks and being able to take action in a more organized way.

       

Goal Management Training® has already been a huge success in a group setting and has been scientifically validated to significantly improve the attention and memory of those who complete it. The scientists at Baycrest Health Sciences now want to bring the training to the world through an online course and seed funding is incredibly important because it keeps the project moving. We are then able to use the amount raised here to leverage other funding sources. 

Our contributors will help us achieve funding for the development of an online training program designed to help those suffering from brain health diseases like dementia and Alzheimer's.

 

  •  $15,000 will help fund the development of Goal Management Training®

  • The program was developed by scientists at Baycrest Health Sciences ans has been scientifically validated through studies conducted over the last 15 years.

  • The in-person program has been shown to be effective in older adults and patients with more severe cognitive deficits.

  • It has also been studied with brain imaging that allows neuroscientists to examine how the training affects the brain.

  • The last step we need to achieve is to translate it into an online training program so that people anywhere in the world can benefit from the online training!

  • Along the way to our fundraising goal, you will receive perks! These perks greatly benefit those who are interested in cognitive neuroscience and Alzheimer's disease.

                 



Your contribution will make a difference in a BIG way.

  • The online program will greatly reduce the cost of administering the program.

  • With an online platform, the program will be able to reach a greater population, even people living in remote areas.

  • People who have limited ability to travel for group sessions will be able to access it from the comforts of their home.

  • People will be able to work on the program any time of the day, so even those who are busy during regular business hours can take part in the training online.

  • Our perks will give you the insight to cutting-edge advances in cognitive research.

   

                     

           

Being able to succeed means hitting our $15,000 target. 

The money we raise will go towards the development of the online training program and the running of a study that will ensure that the program in its new format is as effective as its standard format. The study will be conducted by scientists at Baycrest Health Sciences, who believe that the structured format of the in-person training make it highly suitable for an online delivery. The online training will also provide access to an online therapist who will support the trainees through their journey.


1. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

2. Share the campaign with your friends, co-workers, and family!

3. Social media can spread the word quickly to help us reach our goal!


See below a video about the in-person training program.

story:
Short Summary

Hello fitness junkies, everyday joe's and kids!  We are a couple of fit, energetic and entertaining brother's that want to bring a fresh twist to the ubiquitous, often mundane fitness video.  We hail from the beautiful north woods of Walker, MN and want to bring our small town corkiness to the big screen(or small private television in the comfort of your own home).

The concept is simple, create a workout video that is functional as well as enjoyable and laughable.

 Being fit feels good, don't you want to feel good while having the time of your life?  

What We Need & What You Get

As you know, when embarking on any sort of project there will be a demand for financial needs to accommodate for various production costs including:  specific supplies, transportation, space rental and other expenses.  

Listed below is the exact dollar amount we need for each component to make our fitness video dream a reality.  Also, depending on how much you are willing to donate you will receive a prize corresponding to the dollar amount you give (these prizing are listed under the "Perks" section).   

Expenses

Filming

  1. Filming Equipment to Purchase (SD card and camera battery) $75
  2. Rental Filming equipment (lighting, lavalieres/headsets)           $400
  3. Set Building $350
  4. Studio Space $540
  5. Attire $235
  6. Actors/Craft Service $500  
Total Filming: $2100

Post Production 

  1. Outside Final Editing Team (Including audio andvideo mastering and motion graphics) $300
  2. Online Advertising/Marketing $300
  3. Promotional Apparel (Sweatbands, T-shirts, etc) $200
  4. DVD Production/Distribution (Possible partnership with production company) $1000

Total Post Production $1800

Complete budget: $3900


The Impact

You have to opportunity to be apart of something HUGE!  

Our goal is to create a world with healthier individuals specifically in the United States.  With the rising epidemic of childhood obesity we must do something to bring fit/healthy lifestyles back to the community!  

  • 10% of our total production profit proceeds will go towards childhood obesity awareness and prevention facilities across the nation.  
  • We want to put a smile both externally on your face(from crazy humorous antics) and internally within your body(from functional hard fitness routines).  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody has the luxury to donate but you can still help us out by raising awareness, tell your friends and support the cause.  
Thank you kindly for your time!  Now let's make sommertime fitness a dream come true!

Complete budget: $3900

The Impact
 You have to opportunity to be apart of something HUGE!  
Our goal is to create a world with healthier individuals specifically in the United States.  With the rising epidemic of childhood obesity we must do something to bring fit/healthy lifestyles back to the community!  

10% of our total production profit proceeds will go towards childhood obesity awareness and prevention facilities across the nation.   We want to put a smile both externally on your face(from crazy humorous antics) and internally within your body(from functional hard fitness routines).      Other Ways You Can Help


We understand that not everybody has the luxury to donate but you can still help us out by raising awareness, tell your friends and support the cause.  
Thank you kindly for your time!  Now let's make sommertime fitness a dream come true!

story:
About Us

  • We're a small sports performance company, TITUS Human Performance, that has the solution to childhood obesity.  That solution is CHAMPIONS.  CHAMPIONS started in Tallahassee, Florida in 2006 and has had great results ever since.  My name is Andrew Lewis, I'm 25 years old, and I was born and raised in Jacksonville, Florida.  I love sports, training, and have a passion for coaching and teaching people.  I moved to Tallahassee, FL in 2008 for college and was hired into CHAMPIONS as a coach.  Long story short, I moved to Orlando, FL in 2014 to start the program in two schools, Rosemont Elementary and Meadowbrook Middle schools.  We got great results this past year but were not re-funded due to financial barriers.  I recently got married on June 13th and my wife has a job opportunity in Jacksonville which we can't pass up!  We're very excited to move back home with family and friends.  Unfortunately, CHAMPIONS is not present in Jacksonville.  I love what CHAMPIONS has done for everyone involved over the years.  It's taught coaches responsibility, structure, organization, communication, team work, work ethic, entrepreneurship, and people skills.  With positive role models in place, not only are students taught exercises and games, but also awareness of their surroundings, making choices, and reflecting on those choices.  People need to make choices, not sit on the side-lines.  Leaders make choices and whether good or bad, they learn from it.  WHAT IS CHAMPIONS?   

  • CHAMPIONS is a prevention-driven health and wellness program delivered to the public school student population, grades K-8. This comprehensive program is based on principles and techniques designed to improve gross motor skills, flexibility, posture, strength, balance and coordination using a long-term physical development approach to fitness and nutrition. Modeled after collaborative, community-based wellness initiatives, our mission is to bend this trend by encouraging a lifestyle of regular physical activity and healthy choices.  This model is outcome-driven and has proven to be effective in consistently normalizing BMI over a nine-year period for a student population that exceeds 25,000 students, which no other childhood obesity program has proven to do. 

     

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm asking for $46,395 to be in one elementary or middle school during the school day for the Jacksonville area.  The money is going toward: 1. Professional development: Training for PE Coaches ($900), 2. Technology: Storing student's results and delivering outcomes ($1,263), 3. Curriculum: Exercise and game outlines ($750), 4. Labor: $25/hour, 40 hours/week, 36 weeks/year for 1 coach ($43,200), and 5. Insurance: Workers comp. and general liability ($252).
  • Perks: No matter how much you give, $1, $25, $50, $75, $100, or $50,000, you will get the Fall and Spring semester results with explanation and video updates from our YouTube channel.  
  • The CHAMPIONS Program has been in the Tallahassee region for nine years.  We have positively impacted 25,000 students in 55 schools.  In that time, we have normalized BMI, which no other childhood obesity program has proved to do, and improved multiple performance assessments (Broad jump, 40 yard dash, etc.).  If I don't reach the entire goal, I will put the money toward the Tallahassee region.  

The Impact

  • “Imagine our world with no grandparents. Imagine our country where our health begins to fail at 60, and an 80th birthday is unthinkable. Imagine our Nation with the fewest seniors in the world. That will soon be a reality, if we don’t act. Over the past 40 years, the number of obese American children has increased by over 400%. If this epidemic is not mitigated, 23 million children run the risk of being the first American generation to live shorter life spans than their parents. The financial burden is tremendous with childhood obesity costing $14 billion annually in preventable medical expenses, indirect costs and lost productivity.” -Congressman James Moran, 8th Congressional District Representative, Virginia, U.S. House of Representatives.
  • The CHAMPIONS program was launched in 2006 with ten schools in Leon County (Tallahassee, Florida) through a community partnership with a local HMO, Capital Health Plan. In its ninth year, the program has expanded into three other north Florida counties and three Delaware counties, now being delivered to 55 schools. The CHAMPIONS model is outcome-driven and has proven to be effective in consistently normalizing BMI over a nine-year period for a student population that exceeds 25,000 students. It has gained national attention from both the Alliance of Community Health Plans and the National ‘Let’s Move!’ Initiative.
Risks & Challenges
  • Anytime you go into a place as a guest, it takes time to be accepted.  Every time we've started in a school, it's taken time to be trusted.  Once we earn that trust, we become a part of that school's culture and ultimately become a positive role model for the students.  I helped start the CHAMPIONS program in Orlando, Florida this past year in two schools, Rosemont Elementary and Meadowbrook Middle School.  We've never had any presence in Orlando, so the teachers and students had never heard of us.  It was a challenge at first to get the buy-in from the teachers and students but through hard-work and communication, we built a dynamic PE program with great results to prove it.  We understand PE Coaches have goals to meet and we'll be there to help them reach their goals for the students.  We're respectful to everyone and will find solutions for PE Coach's problems.
Other Ways You Can Help
  • If you can't contribute, you can still help!  I understand money can be tight, I just got married!  Please get the word out and make some noise!  There is so much research on what physical activity does for people, especially children, so let's get them moving!  Also, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Can cooking a dinner cause death ?

Yes ! Nearly 488 200 people in India die every year due to "Household Air Pollution (HAP)" caused by traditional smoky stoves( 3 stone fires).

“Having an open fire in your kitchen is like burning 400 cigarettes an hour in your kitchen,” says Kirk Smith, a professor of global environmental health at the University of California at Berkeley.

  • Poorly designed smoky stoves of traditional type emit CO,CO2 and Particulate matter. These enter the respiratory system of the cook(usually women) and aggravate breathing related illness like Asthma, TB , bronchitis etc.
  • More than 65% of households in rural India cook on biomass based smoky  mud-stoves (called chulhas) which not only consume people's health but also trees.
  • 89% of trees felled in India  for firewood.

What is the solution ? Introduce clean and efficient wood saving cookstoves in these  kitchens filled with carbon soot.

If people can't access clean cookstoves,it is because they cannot find a good one and if they find a good one , they are not affordable......

How can we create access to clean energy (stoves) in kitchens for people who cannot even afford a proper shelter ?


Gift the women of Dhanushkodi 100 clean cookstoves? Yes ! They last longer than the kitchens!


Why Tamil Nadu:

Tamilnadu-The land of temples  is home to many dialects and tasty food varieties. The tasty food varieties are made in kitchens with smoky wood stoves .

Tamil Nadu has a Household Air Pollution(HAP) exposure of 150-200 micrograms of PM 2.5 (particulate matter less than 2.5 micrometres and which is respirable) per cubic metre of air — almost five times the WHO’s guideline range of 10-35 micrograms per cubic metre.(http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/household-air-pollution-way-beyond-safe-limitsin-india/article5418834.ece)

Moreover, the monthly per capita quantity of consumption of firewood & chips in Tamil Nadu(rural) is 19.27 kg which is marginally more than the national average of 19.036 kg.(As per NSS Report No. 558: Household Consumption of Various Goods and Services in India, 2011-12).


This is a strong proof for the traditional usage of wood stoves in Tamil Nadu. Dhanushkodi , which is still a picture of vitage 1960s is not much different ! Only solar lamps have invaded the household space. The kitchens remain the same. Mud stoves have given way to cement stoves !

Why is  Dhanushkodi the project area?

(Picture : Thatched huts in Dhanushkodi ; Jeep & Vans :The only mode of transport)

Dhanushkodi or Danushkodi (Tamil: தனுஷ்கோடி,meaning 'end of the bow') is a forsaken ,ghostly town at the south-eastern tip of Pamban Island of the Tamil Nadu state of India. A cyclonic storm with high velocity winds and high tidal waves hit Dhanushkodi town from 22 December 1964 midnight to 25 December 1964 evening causing heavy damages and destroying the entire town of Dhanushkodi.The scale of the disaster left villages isolated for at least three days and without food or clean water. Communication lines were severely damaged and hampered relief efforts.  At least 1,800 people lost their lives as a result of the cyclone.

This deserted island is occupied by huts of fisherfolk who seem to live in isolation and with no connection other than jeeps to the mainland and their main means of survival seems to depend on the fish they catch from the sea.

There are about 300 families near Mandapam at Dhanushkodi who need clean cookstoves. For this cookstove project ,the grass root implementer is an entrepreneur who has installed solar lights under the aegis of VK-NARDEP (http://www.vknardep.org/) . The entrepreneur Mr.Mohanram (the old gentleman in picture below) will also help us identify the 100 needy beneficiaries among the 300 families.



What is left today are the white sands, salt eaten ruins and a handful of fisher families who have made the barren land their home with thatch walls & roof.

The primary source of water is from small aquifiers dug in the sands.The fishermen’s houses are built with thatch wall and roofs without electricity, people are using solar panels, which is fixed on the thatch roof for electricit.

Dhanushkodi needs a major upheaval for the world to witness a sea change through economic activity. The first step would be the installation of the TLUD charcoal making stoves and the Surabi wood burning stoves. This can bring a major change in the economic activity of the people.

The availability of casuarina makes it possible for the people to access firewood for fuel. As the village folks are economically weak, they cannot afford clean cookstoves. Most of the women in Dhanushkodi cook on smoky three stone fires and mud chulhas which cause respiratory illnesses in these women.The women of Dhanushkodi need clean cookstoves and only an external funding can help them procure the clean cookstoves .These situations can see the brighter side of life if the traditional ,smokey cookstoves are replaced by improved ,efficient and low smoke cookstoves from Servals !

Who is the Project Implementer ?

It is Servals !


Servals Automation is a social enterprise involved manufacturing of different types of improved cookstoves as per the Indian style of cooking.

Servals has been instrumental in setting up of one of the largest carbon funded gasifier cookstove program under Gold Standard Registration in Sunderbans ,West Bengal.

More than 8500 cookstoves have been installed in the program ,thereby reducing the Carbon di-oxide emission by 31875 tonne till date. The use of each of these 8500 cookstoves has prevented 15100 trees from being cut for firewood during the stove's estimated lifetime of 7 years.

Servals intends to replicate a similar program in different place in specifically in  Dhanushkodi which has seen wide widespread felling of trees for firewood in rural areas.

About the Servals Stove Package

What is special about the combo -TLUD charcoal making stove and Surabi Wood Stove ?

While the Surabi Wood Stove would help the women(cook) to adapt easily to the technology change/conversion, the TLUD charcoal making stove would transform(reduce by pyrolysis) the renewable biomass into sale-able charcoal. Both the stoves can be effectively used for cooking for long duration.The charcoal is a byproduct of combustion that the user would get during cooking and , there hence, the user need not allocate extra time for generating charcoal.There are nearly 52 documented uses of charcoal.

If 100 TLUD stoves are installed in a cluster, it would generate at least  750 to 1000 kg of charcoal.Either this generated charcoal can be sold in local market or can be converted into different products. The stove together has the ability to save at least 2.5 to 3 tonne of CO2 from being let into the atmosphere every year.

Firewood collection requires significant time, with the traditional stove user household (HH) spending around 660 hours per year(12 hours every week) on average for firewood collection . By using Servals stove package(TLUD charcoal generating stove plus Surabi wood stove  model) , women can save about 40 hours and 50% of firewood every month which can be usefully spent with her children or in any other activity for livelihood generation .

Servals TLUD stove, one of the two model stoves that we intend to implement on field can help the household women earn about 3 $ every month through charcoal sales (which they can utilize for  buying good food for their children). The other stove -Surabi is designed exclusively for renewable biomass like twigs. This would prevent people from cutting down wood.


What We Need & What You Get

Servals would need USD 69.58 per Servals Stove Package(SSP)- a combo of TLUD charcoal generating stove+Surabi wood burning stove- for covering the cost of manufacturing ,logistics(from Chennai to Dhanushkodi) and housewise installation . This would amount to 69.58 USD for 100 SSPs.

  • A single donor contributing 100 USD would get a "thank you" card  containing the"family with the stove" photo via email.
  • After three months from the date of installation of the stove, each donor would get an email report on "how the stove has impacted the life of the beneficiary?".


The Impact

  • A donor funding a Servals Stove Package(SSP)  to a household in Tamil Nadu will help the women  in kitchen breathe in a cleaner environment
  • The donor will help save more than 35  trees per stove package during the stove's lifetime.(considering TLUD alone)
  • It will also save 10 hours every week for the women to spend usefully which otherwise would have been spent collecting firewood.
  • A single TLUD stove reduces emission by 2.5 tonnes per year(considering charcoal) and a single Surabi will reduce emission by 1 tonne per year.

We intend to pilot 100 stoves to  jump-start the campaign of  converting "one-kitchen-at-a-time" into "clean kitchens"

  • 100 Servals Stove Packages in a cluster will help in warding off more than 250 to 300 tonnes of carbon di-oxide from entering the atmosphere.
  • A 100 stove cluster can generate 1 tonne of charcoal every month which will give fillip for a new livelihood/economic activity for the household women.

The success in Sunderbans is a testimony to the fact that we have been able to change the lives of people through stoves .http://www.biochar-international.org/sites/default/files/Servals-Sapient_TLUD_Pilot_Study-Sunderbans_project.pdf

http://www.slideshare.net/ashiq25/earn-while-you-cook-sunderbans-project-achievements

Risks & Challenges


  • The main challenge is to make the user get adapted to the new clean stove as "the familiarity" with traditional stove will make the household women to stick on to the old stove even though the latter smokes.
  • As the user gets acclimatized to the cookstove usage patterns and observes the convenience factor in real time, the user will slowly revert from the old traditional stove.This challenge will be broken by incentivizing the user via sale of the high-grade charcoal generated in TLUD stove. The user will be able to collect 10-15 kgs of charcoal towards end of every month.

    Help Spread the word of Servals through social media campaigns in case you cannot help gifting the stove to a household woman in Dhanushkodi.


    Some of our product videos created by our associates/partners :

    Audio Language : English

    http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=cm0JR6ikpL0

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JQqbu4QD9Bs

    Audio Language : German

    1.This is Ralf unpacking the stove

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y8UHulBWJq0&index=3&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa

    2.Ralf and Heiner explaining how to fire it up

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I-1_bec8UTU&index=4&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa

    3.Ralf and Heiner explaining about the biomass to use

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zqvZ6BSItO8&index=6&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa

    4.Ralf and Heiner reading from the User Manual

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4nllvnCNimU&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa&index=5

    5.Heiner and Ralf are explaining the use of charcoal

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8M6WzF77ez8&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa&index=7

    6.Ralf and Heiner, what else to do

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aI3av-gyj_U&index=8&list=PL0KL8Q6NsjwODEX58v3rmKvDdd3YPqJVa
